scene.name: intro
scene.line: So, what are you hauling back there? Anything good? You been driving long?

scene.name: antiques
scene.line: Naturally. Do you have any of those little ceramic, um, I want to say `porcelain` figurines? You know, `slice-of-life`?

scene.name: no-figurines
scene.line: They don't sell too well? More of a truck stop thing, huh? Yeah, I get it — you deal in `authenticity`. None of those prefab truck stop antiques, right? You deal in `aura`.

scene.name: junebug-collection
scene.line: Nah, I just like to look at them sometimes. I like how they all have their jobs just `painted on`, you know? Like I saw one in a gas station the other day who could have been either a milkman or a cop — he had that hat and uniform, right? And who knows how it went down — maybe they just had more blue paint that day ... "American Moments Figurine. Cop. Thirty-five dollars."
They posed him next to a dusty milkman, his brother. Fifteen dollars.

scene.name: all-my-life
scene.line: I heard that. We're lifers, too.

scene.name: movie-something-happens
scene.line: `(Gesturing at the screen.)` What are they doing?

scene.name: final
scene.option: Might as well finish the film.
